people.name: Joseph Goebbels
people.description: Paul Joseph Goebbels  was a German politician and Reich Minister of Propaganda in Nazi Germany from 1933 to 1945.

people.name: Franklin W. Dixon
people.description: Franklin W.  Dixon is the pen name used by a variety of different authors  who wrote The Hardy Boys novels for the Stratemeyer Syndicate  as well as for the Ted Scott Flying Stories series published by Grosset & Dunlap.

people.name: Ernst Heinkel
people.description: Dr.  Ernst Heinkel  was a German aircraft designer, manufacturer, Wehrwirtschaftsführer in the Third Reich, and member of the Nazi party.

people.name: Field Eugene Kindley
people.description: Captain Field Eugene Kindley  was an aviator and World War I flying ace credited with twelve confirmed aerial victories.

people.name: Reed G. Landis
people.description: Colonel Reed Gresham Landis  was an American military aviator and the only son of federal judge Kenesaw Mountain Landis, the first Commissioner of Baseball.

people.name: Charles W. Lindberg
people.description: Charles W.  "Chuck" Lindberg  was a United States Marine corporal who served in World War II.

people.name: Hilbert Leigh Bair
people.description: Lieutenant  Hilbert Leigh Bair began his service career as a World War I flying ace credited with six aerial victories.

items.name: Miles Mohawk
items.description: It is a book about Miles Mohawk. It says: The Miles M. 12 Mohawk was a 1930s British two-seat, tandem cabin monoplane built by Phillip & Powis Aircraft  to the order of Charles Lindbergh in 1936.   The following people are mentioned:  Royal Air Force RAF Turnhouse Royal Air Force Museum  And the following place: Prairie Grove, Arkansas

items.description: It is a book about World War II.
